intro: Paracephaelis comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the Comoros archipelago. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant blossoms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, thriving in the humid climate of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
